caption: We followed a guided tour for kids adapted to families in the Lafayette Anticipations with kid-friendly guides. We loved it. It was very well organized, short enough to engage with little kids (2 to 6) everyone was happy thank you. There is a little shop boutique where you can get a souvenir and vegetarian healthy food.

Modern & spacious museum; free entry with bookstore & cafe; current exhibition Au DelÃ  curated by Agnes Gryczkowska, with works from 20+ artists from different parts of the world, ancient & contemporary, with different mediums such as music, videos, fashion, paintings, and explore themes on life & death, consciousness & afterlife, rituals & religion, with a herbal tea to start off the journey ðŸ¦ ðŸ”ŽðŸŽ§Battalion suggestion: have Friends /membership to keep them informed & involved in programs & activities

Some potential with this modular building by Koolhaas. Wild and the Moon for eating and drinking. Very sober and minimal opening. So if it's keeping going that way it must be interesting with some risks, possible accidents and surprises with this constant changing architecture. Looking forward seeing more.
Margiela exhibition was really interesting and amazingly presented. The staff were really helpful. The boutique also had lots of nice art books and objects. Iâ€™d visit again for sure!
Always good exhibitions. Nice location. There is even a cafe!
Beautiful but really donâ€™t understand the art in here. But I guess itâ€™s just my personal opinion. Entrance is free and smooth. There is also a bar inside where you can chill.
superb experience! loved it
We went to visit the Martin Margiela expo, and it was totally worth the visit. Also thanks to the great tour we got. Also the building is fascinating.
Stumbled across this gallery with a 3 floor exhibition.  Wonderful space with a lots of light.  Warm welcome from the front desk, and intriguing exhibition by Xinyi Cheng.
Another OMAâ€™s master piece. The zipper building. When you think that you can not invent a thing in architecture.

Fantastic gallery pushing contemporary artists on the fringes of the art world . The small team at LA work super hard to deliver thought provoking exhibitions and events which reach out to the wider community for all ages and backgrounds.  They also have a shop selling magazines, records and objects from a range of contributors alongside a seating area for socialising, relaxing with a small restaurant serving drinks and food. I always come here when visiting Paris.
Always cutting edge contemporary art exhibition. A place to visit if you're in the Marais and you like art architecture and craftmanship. Free entrance and great art guides
Surprisingly good! Free, quality installations. Good contemporary art. Small cafe and shop on the main floor. Loved the video install on the top floor. Went twice.
Great exhibition featuring Issy Wood. Friendly staff and very calm / soothing ambiance. Loved the cafe !

Hosting a conceptual Martin Margiela exhibition when one visited, this little known contemporary art place benefits from a welcoming space and the most adorable staff ever. One had the most embarassing problem there and not less than three persons join forces to solve it. Unbelievable dedication to welcoming guests !
Exposition Martin Margiela Quite a good experience...
Very nice art gallery with an excellent Vegan restaurant cafÃ© at the ground floor with many options on the menu. check out the Performances are done on the second floor.

Anticipations = hospitality  Lafayette Foundation is a great cultural venue for spending a Sunday afternoon amidst exhibitions and performances.  Its artistic program is great when it comes to "les arts vivants", although it could be better in the visual arts field. Nonetheless, the architecture by Rem Koolhas is worth visiting it. The cafÃ©-restaurant offers a great environment for a meeting or just chill out, and the entire experience is about HOSPITALITY since the very entrance. I really appreciate that welcoming atmosphere. Keep doing it!

As usual when I make my annual trek to Paris, I love wandering around exploring, particularly boutiques.  I love the creativity of the windows and the curated items for sale.  Ã€ Rebours was one of those special places I happened upon while wandering Le Marais.  The boutique was chock a block with artistic clothing, accessories, ceramics, food items, on and on. Example; I purchased one of many series of artist created patches by Mathieu Mercier as well as configure in unique and beautiful packaging from Coursan-en-Othe, France.  Highly recommend!  And soon there will be an Eataly around the corner!
Unmissable free exhibition space with very cute cafÃ© and restaurant. A must-go in Paris!
Free exhibition in Paris !
A beautiful building with very interesting exhibitions and a quirky little cafe (that's a bit too expensive). Make sure to check out the gift shop!
Free contemporary art exhibition space in the Marais. Very good selection of artists and very interesting architecture by OMA
A concept museum with extraordinary exhibitions. Small and interisting. Made for a quick stop. Nice little cafe and patio.
Beautifully curated Expo Martin Margiela, would absolutely recommend this for all art, fashion and architecture enthusiast!
Great space and interesting exhibition. + itâ€™s free of charge! Amazing!
Cool venue for a medium sized concert, very chilled out atmosphere and easy access from the street
